<br />
When the sun is out I reach for this perfume. Its floral and fresh yet creamy. Wish it lasted a little longer but it makes me happy re-spraying this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2193349"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2193349#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2192253" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2192253" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="semataryprincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1894776"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1894776.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="semataryprincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2192253ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2192253" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1894776">semataryprincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-18">06/18/24 13:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely LOVE this perfume and I think its a great blind buy for ylang ylang and coconut lovers. it's a very floral coconut smell for me but I think this is a perfume that's very dependant on skin type. it smells very dry on some people though. <br />
<br />
for me it smells a little more mature but summery/beachy, I'm 17, so it reminds me of a woman in her early 20s taking a walk in a beachy town with her friends. I feel like if I went to a spa or a resort the woman staff would smell like this. <br />
<br />
it lasts extremely long on clothes, and you only need about 3 sprays on your wrists and back of neck to smell it for a few hours. <br />
<br />
even though the perfume is on the more floral/clean smelling side It doesn't give me a headache! I love to spray it after the shower or over my sunscreen </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2192253"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2192253#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2190858" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2190858" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zombieldehyde"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/536832"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.536832.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zombieldehyde" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2190858ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2190858" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/536832">zombieldehyde</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-17">06/17/24 08:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do not detect any oceanic scent to it. To me, its all ylang ylang with tad bit of coconut. My boyfriend says it smells very Filipino and I agree. The ylang ylang is the star of the show and this evokes the beach in the Philippines kind of smell. However, thats also why I dont like it that much. It smells so common here that I wont gravitate towards it. If youve walked past an ylang ylang tree, youll know how it smells exactly like this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2190858"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2190858#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2188291" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2188291" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clairaya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2164860"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="clairaya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2188291ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2188291" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2164860">clairaya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-14">06/14/24 13:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pretty basic white floral, there's the slightest hint of salt but nothing to evoke a beach walk. Musky and powdery but, to me, in more of a baby powder way rather than sunscreen as I've seen in other reviews. It's fine.<br />
<br />
5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2188291"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2188291#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2179910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2179910" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ash_nobody"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2141263"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ash_nobody" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2179910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2179910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2141263">ash_nobody</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-06">06/06/24 07:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have never sampled the original Masion Margiela Beach Walk, but I did sample the Dossier version, Aquatic Coconut and that smells super close to Roja Parfums' newest fragrance Isola Sol which is almost $500 for a 1.7oz. This was very interesting to me. Initially, I loved Isola Sol, but after wearing it I pick up the salty notes and white flowers which I'm not a fan of. Iso Sol is also similar to Kilian's Sunkissed Goddess and M. Micallef Ylang in Gold...I was having trouble picking my favorites from the four, but IMO, Ylang in Gold is much more creamy and beautiful, Sunskissed Goddess is similar to Ylang in Gold, but just different enough and a little woodier with the guaiac wood to add to my collection. Beach Walk and Isola Sol share the salty notes (which isn't a note in Beach Walk) and more of the white florals scents whereas Ylang in Gold and Sunkissed Goddess are creamier and woodier. If you like Roja Isola Sol, get Beach Walk or Aquatic Coconut by Dossier.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2179910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2179910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2179047" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2179047" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Entr3_Nou5"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030846"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2030846.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Entr3_Nou5" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2179047ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2179047" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030846">Entr3_Nou5</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-05">06/05/24 12:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This bad boy smells like straight up sunscreen. Which sounds like Im insulting it, but I quite like the smell of sunscreen and the memories it brings. My one problem is that all of the Replica scents seem to have this core DNA that smells almost musty to me and I dont like it. As long as I dont sniff my wrist up close its pretty good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2179047"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2179047#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2178340" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2178340" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Apaolone04"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1596253.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Apaolone04" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Omnia-Profumi/Madera-9534.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9534.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madera"title="Madera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2178340ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2178340" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1596253">Apaolone04</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-04">06/04/24 21:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume smells incredibly nostalgic to me, so my review may be biased. I normally wouldnt go for such a strong floral, I love beachy scents. Hibiscus Palm by Aerin and Lust for Sun by JHAG were both way too floral for me but I recognize their similarities. This perfume also has notes I tend to prefer like pink pepper, coconut, and heliotrope. Beach Walk is special to me and Ive noticed in my friend circle no one else likes it. Idc it gives rich auntie vibes. Its a pretty dry scent, heavy on florals and musk. I have no business liking this perfume so much but its just perfect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2178340"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2178340#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2173735" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2173735" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hrhalexandru6"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1900210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1900210.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hrhalexandru6" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Babycat-73149.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73149.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Babycat"title="Babycat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2173735ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2173735" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1900210">hrhalexandru6</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 12:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a salty thing. Definitely more feminine-leaning. On my skin, the musk takes over and I can still smell a bit of some floral mambo-jambo here and there. It's okay, but this is not anything that would remind me of a beach walk, per se, it reminds me of an aquatically-inclined shower gel from Zara Home, rather than having its own special identity. Otherwise it's okay.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2173735"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2173735#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2173515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2173515" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="heyybeech"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2129102"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="heyybeech" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/I-am-Trash-Les-Fleurs-du-Dechet-50009.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50009.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="I am Trash - Les Fleurs du Dchet"title="I am Trash - Les Fleurs du Dchet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2173515ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2173515" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2129102">heyybeech</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-31">05/31/24 09:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted something summery for the office, and I found it! It's light enough to be worn without offending the people next to you and smells like the reminder you need that it's summertime. It is an EDT, which I didn't know until after I bought it, so it doesn't last as long as I wanted it to...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2173515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2173515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2171543" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2171543" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Moonflower2012"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/368914"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.368914.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Moonflower2012" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Goutal/Tenue-de-Soiree-39469.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39469.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tenue de Soiree"title="Tenue de Soiree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2171543ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2171543" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/368914">Moonflower2012</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-29">05/29/24 12:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me, it has the fresh smell of a sea breeze in a winter garden. Its very realistic but I dont necessarily want to smell like this. Id describe it as an aromascape! Its an olfactory portrait of a seaside walk. But for me, its not a perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2171543"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2171543#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2170066" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2170066" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gyps"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564657"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1564657.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gyps" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elizabeth-Arden/Pretty-5268.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5268.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pretty"title="Pretty"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2170066ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2170066" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564657">Gyps</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-28">05/28/24 05:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice perfume. Starts out smelling a bit like Olympea but changed quickly. Fresh scent, but I cant smell any coconut. I dont think it smells like sunscreen like many have commented below. Maybe an EDP version would last longer. I only found out it was an EDT tonight. If I had realized I would not have bought.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2170066"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2170066#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2166723" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2166723" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CynicalPink"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1924789"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1924789.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CynicalPink" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Book-50618.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50618.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Book"title="Book"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2166723ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2166723" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); This was it for about 20 seconds. After that, it became a yellow floral bomb. A nice yellow floral, but thats the only note that stands out. Such a tease. The hunt continues.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2166723"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2166723#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2164100" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2164100" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aleks4920"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2102318"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aleks4920" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Acqua-di-Parma-Blu-Mediterraneo-Fico-di-Amalfi-1687.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1687.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"title="Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Fico di Amalfi"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2164100ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2164100" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2102318">Aleks4920</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-22">05/22/24 07:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very nice and elegant coconut scent, I personally don't agree with the people that say it smells like lotion, it has a more fresh and spicy smell to it that I enjoy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2164100"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2164100#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2161893" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2161893" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vi101101"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2002777"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vi101101" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2161893ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2161893" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2002777">Vi101101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-20">05/20/24 07:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My 1st impression: Guurlz, I love this one. Not the best fragrance that I've smelt, but it's good. Way better than "Lazy Sunday Morning". Clean, fresh, sweet and pleasant. I bit floral. I can't identify the coconut note in this one. It doesn't make it worse. The combination of notes creates a good smell that can be worn in hot weather. <br />
I'll see whether it'll be as pleasant as it started at the end of the day. I'll update this review later.<br />
<br />
UPD: one of the best fragrances from the Replica line. It screams "clean". I can't even find the right words to describe it. The fragrance is just miraculous. It reminds me of the clean beaches full of shells during the sunset. When I smell the fragrance, I think of sea shells. I don't know why. It's really hard for me to describe it. I love this scent! I could identify the coconut note. This is what gives this scent freshness, but it's not prominent.<br />
It has beach vibes, but not in marine or aquatic way. I wish it had a bigger projection.<br />
The scent is linear, by the way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2161893"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2161893#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2151392" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Would not describe it as having a sunscreen-like scent for this reason. I love this perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2150942"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2150942#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2148965" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2148965" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dimanta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1430960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1430960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dimanta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Myrrh-Tonka-42027.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42027.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myrrh & Tonka"title="Myrrh & Tonka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2148965ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2148965" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1430960">Dimanta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-07">05/07/24 19:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Initially I did not like this perfume. I was feeling nauseous from it and I hated the coconut note in it. It reminded me of Alien Goddess that I also dont like.<br />
After few weeks I tested it again, let it sit on my skin and after few hours I kept getting whiffs of this beautiful airy, beachy scent. The coconut note fades and I think the ylang-ylang flower note takes over. Its very unique and beautiful scent. I fell in love with it each time I wear it. Its pretty long lasting too. This would be a great perfume to gift to someone who likes fresh, clean, airy summer scents without any sweet notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2148965"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2148965#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2148146" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I like this beachy, citrusy fragrance which gives pleasant yet cool vibes!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2148146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2148146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2143790" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2143790" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Silvii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1691140"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1691140.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Silvii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2143790ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2143790" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1691140">Silvii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-02">05/02/24 17:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just received this today. I had first bought Tom Ford Soleil Blanc. I researched and researched because lately I prefer light, soft, scents that lean slightly on the fresh side. But I have also been looking for something beachy for the summer. Soleil Blanc disappointed me...but probably my fault. Realized I ordered a unisex formula. I felt like it was all over the place with trying to be beach-like and smell like sunscreen, but desperate to smell somewhat manly. So I bought Replica - Beach Walk. The best way to describe the scent is like Alien Goddess was mixed with Armani Sun Di Gioia and some Soleil Blanc. It has that exact same Alien goddess DNA. Even though this can be migraine inducing, in the Beach Walk, it's somewhat lighter and not as long lasting. <br />
I have to say for me, this one is quite better than Tom Ford and I can't wait to be outside by the water, smelling like summer!  </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2143790"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2143790#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2142363" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2142363" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahlage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614575"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1614575.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahlage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Si-Passione-48002.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48002.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="S Passione"title="S Passione"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2142363ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2142363" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); It smells exactly like a day at the beach. The candle is also wonderful! This scent is more salty and beachy than sunscreen-y, in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2142363"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2142363#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2140134" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2134123" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stakasaki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1978119"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1978119.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stakasaki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Acqua-Neroli-50623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua Neroli"title="Acqua Neroli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2134123ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2134123" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1978119">stakasaki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 15:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After the initial 5-second blast of offensively sharp citrus and floral, I get a really sweet, musky coconut with some creamy ylang ylang in the background. The sunny, beachy saltiness comes through a bit more on the dry down, and there might be a twinge of cedar in there if I really get up close to my wrist. Overall, it's not bad.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2134123"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2134123#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133696" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133696" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Floralauriel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/289590"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.289590.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Floralauriel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133696ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133696" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/289590">Floralauriel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 08:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrence is lovely.  It smells like the end of the day at a fancy beachfront hotel.  The sun is going down and the sunscreen has been washed off and you're left with a slight coconut scent mixed with salty air, sun-kissed skin, and the spa like scent of the hotel.  It's slightly warm, but not overpoweringly so.  I'll probably be buying a smaller bottle for summer once my sample runs out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2133696"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2133696#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2131047" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1453897">Jehan888</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 15:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Personally this reminds me of SKYLAR CLEAN BEAUTY | SALT AIR EAU DE PARFUM and was surprised that it hasnt been listed under reminds me of yet. Literally identical to my nose but this I would say is a better smelling version of Salt Air,which I got in a perfume discovery set from Macys. I wouldnt buy that but this I can definitely see myself purchasing a bottle.   <br />
<br />
<br />
Edit:ended up picking up a bottle. It also reminds me of Gaultier Divine,I plan to layer the two.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2130877"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2130877#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130734" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130734" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Officiallyvile"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2103795"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Officiallyvile" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130734ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130734" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2103795">Officiallyvile</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 13:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me, this really doesn't have anything to do with the beach, it is actually more like the smell of a fancy hotel lobby/resort. It is very ylang-ylang dominant to my nose. At first i did not smell the coconut at all, however, when it dries down, the coconut comes out - but not like a tropical coconut, more like a very powdery coconut, like a coconut marshmallow. I like it. It can remind somebody of sunscreen, but definitely the expensive kind (the kind that celebrities/rich ladies use). Not an impressive scent but good enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2130734"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2130734#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2128885" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2128619" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Noveight"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/259193"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.259193.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Noveight" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Let-The-Good-Times-Roll-60072.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60072.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Let The Good Times Roll"title="Let The Good Times Roll"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2128619ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2128619" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/259193">Noveight</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 12:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Powdery musk and coconut shavings (not lactonic like coconut milk), then some happy yellow florals. This is a beautiful summer musk that kind of gives me cali-cool girl sunscreen vibes. I love it so much. I think this can be for spring due to the musk and yellow florals or summer. Might be cloying for EXTREMELY hot or humid weather. I dug this out of the back of my perfume drawer and have been enjoying it as it's sunny spring here.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2128619"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2128619#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2125128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2122283" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gecko_emoji"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942747"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1942747.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gecko_emoji" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84095.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sweet Tooth Caramel Dream"title="Sweet Tooth Caramel Dream"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2122283ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2122283" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942747">gecko_emoji</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-12">04/12/24 06:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells nothing like the listed notes on me. It started out smelling like a realistic beach, like warm sand and salt, which was exactly what I was looking for! Then, about two hours in, it suddenly changed to smell like fresh laundry. My co-worker literally mentioned that I smelt like a cotton scented laundry detergent. Thats not necessarily a bad thing, if you enjoy fresh laundry scents then this is one to get. I get a tiny tiny hint of salt, like cotton laundry dried outside on the beach. Slightly disappointed because I was not in the market for a laundry scent and wanted the beach vibe from the first hour to continue all day. Decent staying power, can smell it at arms length and I have had it on for five hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2122283"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2122283#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2122278" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2122278" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elenagr22"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2073783"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="elenagr22" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2122278ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2122278" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); It is almost identical<br />
<br />
Just another white floral forward summer scent! Been done like a million times (Soleil Blanc, Bora Bora, Sunkissed Goddess, Terracotta). Not sweet, sunscreen vibes, a hint of coconut, clean sexy and with good performance<br />
<br />
PS. I wouldn't compare it to either Alien Goddess nor Sun Di Gioia. Yes they have similar DNA but both of them are sweeter</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2122278"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2122278#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2121298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
