Just leaving that there</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2121298"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2121298#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2121047" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2121047" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dj71"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1721315"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1721315.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dj71" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/XOXO/Mi-Amore-17853.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17853.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mi Amore"title="Mi Amore"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2121047ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2121047" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1721315">dj71</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-11">04/11/24 00:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm surprised by so many negative reviews on this.   I find this enjoyable as something I would wear often in the summer and it would be a fun and fitting scent to wear when you go to the beach.   Reminiscent of a coconut sunscreen, with a subtle mix of sweet and salty notes.  While I'm not in love with this scent, it was definitely a pleasant surprise.  I rated this as a "like".</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2121047"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2121047#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2120228" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2120228" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bellalandia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2091211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2091211.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="bellalandia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Regime-des-Fleurs/Himitsu-72664.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72664.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Himitsu"title="Himitsu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2120228ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2120228" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2091211">bellalandia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-10">04/10/24 06:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had it and sold it immediatly. I bet my mom would like it. Smells like something chanel would put out, and im not that big chanel-fragrance fan. Very citrusy, not sweet. Smells a little bit like sweat you have after bathing in salt water with this strong headachy alcoholic tone. Very fresh, not for me. <br />
Its summery and strong. If you want it, go for it, especially if u like fresh citrusy scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2120228"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2120228#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2118172" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2118172" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fragwhore&lt;3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1726645"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="fragwhore&lt;3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ellis-Brooklyn/Salt-60584.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60584.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Salt"title="Salt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2118172ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2118172" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1726645">fragwhore&lt;3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-08">04/08/24 09:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No, just no. If I wanted to smell like a half asses sour coconut I would just rub myself with coconut. It's weird because there is so much coconut yet also so much salt and sun which I think just makes it nasty. Was hoping for the best with the ylang ylang but I feel like by the time I smelt it, minutes later everything was gone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2118172"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2118172#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2115245" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2115245" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Heatcraig"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1977785"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Heatcraig" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2115245ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2115245" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1977785">Heatcraig</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-05">04/05/24 10:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a love/hate with this one.  What I am learning about myself through trying to find a summer scent is that I don't prefer strong coconut scents. This perfume opens with a very coconut-y, sunscreen-y, beachy scent.  For me, the coconut fades and then the summery fresh florals (mostly the ylang-ylang) make an appearance after about an hour which I do like. It's just the initial spray of sunscreen that I need to get past and often times Im not in the mood to deal with that. It's still quite cold where I live, so perhaps I will change my mind when summer hits, but now for its meh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2115245"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2115245#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2114427" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2114427" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gvmfrag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2084653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2084653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gvmfrag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2114427ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2114427" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2084653">gvmfrag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-04">04/04/24 14:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful fragrance if you want a very typical beach scent that is not too perfumey. It smells like a floral sunscreen but not overly synthetic because of its very light projection. It makes it almost like a "clean" sunscreen smell. It's also well balanced between the florals and coconut, so it doesn't smell generic and cheap like some other summer perfumes tend to.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2114427"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2114427#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2114403" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2114403" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ThetideGoesWithme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2079008"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2079008.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ThetideGoesWithme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2114403ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2114403" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2079008">ThetideGoesWithme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-04">04/04/24 13:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like a beach vacation, specifically after you come back from the beach, shower, and get ready to go out to eat. Clean and floral from a shower, still smelling a bit like sunscreen and salt, ready to relax or go out. That's beach walk.<br />
<br />
I love combining this with sol de Janeiro body lotion. This can be a day scent, but it shines in the evening. If you just need a pick me up, a scent that brings you to your happy place - which in this case has to be that middle of summer beach day- reach for Beach Walk.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090688" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cookierun"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1926031"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1926031.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cookierun" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090688ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090688" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1926031">cookierun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-12">03/12/24 16:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>like most reviewers, it smells like sticky creamy sunscreen for me. i'm starting to think that maybe coconut is a note that i only like in theory, because i have yet to find a fragrance with one executed to my liking. i guess it fits well with replica's mission for capturing memories, because this smells exactly like every childhood vacation at a caribbean resort that i had ever been on. not terrible, but definitely not worth $175 for me as the scent faded extremely quickly most times. that being said, i decided to use up the last part of my sample today by layering with another sample (specifically, chanel gabrielle) and liked the result. i feel like this has a warmth that adds a buttery, slightly salty quality to florals.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Sweet creamy and not synthetic. Amazing projection</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2089105"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2089105#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088975" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1950146">Chloerose666</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 07:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one has slightly worse longevity on me compared to on a date and btfp. I do like it and find it completely inoffensive, a suncream like smell. Holiday vibes and would be nice just as a day fragrance on holiday. <br />
<br />
It smells just like those little jelly like things you could buy for the bath in the 90s/early 00s.. they were like rubbery little pods in the shape of seashells or something that gradually dissolved in the water, I got such a blast from the past sniffing this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2079017" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="crowbaby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2036007.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="crowbaby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2079017ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2079017" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036007">crowbaby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 10:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i find replica in general to be so unbelievably overrated BUT i do like (?) this perfume. i bought this forever ago and used it for a bit but stopped because i realized it made me feel too... mature? not elderly. just... not quite right for my personality. if i was a sexy old-money woman in her 50s who lived in a beach town, this would work. but i'm not. i'm a creature of a late-twenties woman who lives in a beach town. i'm experiencing the death of a party girl; i'm still young but not in the same way. but this made me feel like i had given up on youthfulness altogether. i like it, but not enough to pretend it suits me at all.<br />
<br />
very floral, but dry florals. sandy. a little salty. coconutty, but not NEARLY enough coconut... nearly no sweetness.<br />
<br />
i layer this with utopia 21 at the moment and the combo is pretty heavenly. utopia definitely "dumbs down" the sophistication of BW, adding much needed sweetness, while BW adds longevity to utopia. i like it! i will keep hunting for my signature fragrance, though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/274966">aud88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-26">02/26/24 17:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I want to love this.   I really do.  The notes.  The bottle.  The name.  Should be my signature scent.  Every time I try it I smell authentic beachin other words the salty sand.  Very pleasant, but almost too in your face sand to be a lovely perfume. I  am missing a bit of sweetness to balance it and make it more wearable and feminine as a signature scent.  I found Alien Goddess (name does not go well with the scent) to have similar notes with that slight sweetness and cozy vanilla bourbon, cashmere, salty sand dry down.  Might try again layering with Kai or something with a slight floral note to soften it because I feel like I should love it so much more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2065907"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2065907#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2065546" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2065546" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="webblt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1366685"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1366685.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="webblt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/ALTAIA/Yu-Son-32344.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32344.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Yu Son"title="Yu Son"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2065546ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2065546" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1366685">webblt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-17">02/17/24 16:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>yummy sunscreen! not worth a full bottle but it is a playful perfume. lighthearted solar. as with most replica scents, sillage and longevity are good. inoffensive, but so is jessica alba's suncreen brand. buy that instead, at least you will get some sun protection out of it. but the combo of cedar, citrus, and coconut is fairly well-done, just unremarkable. maybe if this were more cedar heavy it would be more interesting. <br />
<br />
also, of course it doesn't smell like the beach--it's not an aquatic or marine. more like walking through dunes. would be a good one to wear to the beach! i imagine it would combine well with a marine environment.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2065546"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2065546#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2060688" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2060688" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Blossomlove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951646"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1951646.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Blossomlove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/God-of-Fire-72381.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72381.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="God of Fire"title="God of Fire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2060688ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2060688" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951646">Blossomlove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-13">02/13/24 00:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a travel spray of this about 6 months ago and now it makes me a bit nauseated. I usually like coconut scents but I had to stop wearing this because I was afraid it was going to ruin coconut for me. I'm glad I just got the travel and not a 3.4oz bottle. I love tropical fragrances and so I'm not giving up on my quest just yet! Most recently I purchased Bombshell Sundrenched and while there is a similarity, the Bombshell flanker is much smoother and has this earthiness with the sand accord. I would suggest that one or if you've got some dough to waste, Solei Blanc from TF. It's a better powdery coconut. Vanilla Vibes is more of a vanilla scent than a beachy scent, imo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2060688"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2060688#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2057012" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2040117" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="blerg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1977878"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="blerg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2040117ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2040117" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1977878">blerg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-23">01/23/24 20:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Initial application, it smells great, absolutely loved it. Mild sweet coconut with light florals and a very clean/aquatic smell with a hint of vanilla. However, after a while it just smells like sunscreen. Not bad but just way overpriced for what it is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2040117"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2040117#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2037119" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2037119" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="szeon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1981971"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1981971.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="szeon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2037119ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2037119" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1981971">szeon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-21">01/21/24 00:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I tested this perfume in stores, I fell in love with the smell. I immediately put it on my wishlist and eventually bought it. After a few wears of this perfume, I can safely say that it is a perfume that is good to only wear for a few hours and also if you want something close to the skin. It smells amazing when you first leave it on, but by the end of the day, it seems to me like you start to smell like sweat. It is a lovely fragrance but I hate that you have to have that fear that you smell bad. It's overpriced. I really wanted to love it, but I don't. However, it's not bad. Replica has better smells.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2037119"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2037119#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2034414" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410281">Dumbplings</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-18">01/18/24 04:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I hate the smell of this so much! this type of fragrance DNA really annoys me beyond words can explain. All I smell is yellow florals and musk, it's a musky old ladies perfume that smells very generic and boring. I don't get any coconut or lotion even though I really wish I could smell coconut in this I get nothing apart from jasmine, ylang ylang and musk. It's really really bad and not unisex it's all feminine</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2034414"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2034414#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2033095" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033095" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="booksandcats457"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1447947"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="booksandcats457" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aerin/Lilac-Path-19057.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.19057.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lilac Path"title="Lilac Path"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033095ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033095" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1447947">booksandcats457</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-16">01/16/24 18:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not one of my favorites from Replica. All I get is sunscreen. Probably from the coconut note. Its not a bad fragrance and Ill use up my sample, but definitely not interested in spending money on this fragrance when I can get the same effect from a bottle of Hawaiian Tropic or Banana Boat.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2033095"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2033095#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2032150" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2032150" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="benkim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/351263"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="benkim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sospiro-Perfumes/Vibrato-75930.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75930.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vibrato"title="Vibrato"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2032150ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2032150" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/351263">benkim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-15">01/15/24 23:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Transparent Coconut and Clean.<br />
<br />
After few wearing, I've came to realize different facets of the fragrance. I just thought it was a generic coconut musky fragrance that reminds you of sunscreens or anything that you'd put on during a hot summer day at the beach. On my skin, this starts off with coconut with floral note, which dries down to "transparent bordering aquatic" musk florals. There's a very faint coconut-y aspect to it, but I feel like I only sense it because I know that there is supposed to be coconut.<br />
Somehow I don't get citruses one bit, nor the pink pepper (or maybe pink pepper here isn't what I associate the typical pink pepper to be). Moderate projection and longevity. I feel that I do have alternatives to it which I prefer more over Beach Walk, if I wanted salty aquatic beach sun vibes. I personally would not pull the trigger on this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2032150"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2032150#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2030627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2030627" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="autumn02"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1875764"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1875764.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="autumn02" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Granado/Cedro-56510.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56510.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cedro"title="Cedro"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2030627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2030627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1875764">autumn02</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-14">01/14/24 08:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i'm not really a fan of floral fragrances, but then this turned my tongue around. it may not be a beach fragrance for some since it doesnt have acquatic notes, but to me it's the perfect scent for walking at the beachfront. <br />
here, ylang-ylang and heliotrope claim their places calmly, they know they're stars and don't need to do too much. on my skin, the citric top notes didn't stand out at all, not even in the first seconds.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2030627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2030627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2030150" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2030150" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gillzathrillza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1648936"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1648936.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gillzathrillza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/La-Belle-55786.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55786.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Belle"title="La Belle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2030150ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2030150" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1648936">Gillzathrillza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-13">01/13/24 17:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wore this throughout a holiday in Miami, alongside Sol De Janeiro 40, and it was perfect. It behaves well in the warmth and lasts a decent amount of time. Its not too pushy and isnt cloying in the intense heat - a very easy point and spray without much thought.<br />
<br />
Its not my usual kind of scent but its a beautiful holiday memory - all sunscreen, coconut milk and musk. <br />
<br />
It feels like its related to Alien Goddess, Rio Radiance and Gaultier Divine - cousins though, not sisters. <br />
<br />
Ive since passed it on to a friend because I associate it with a specific trip - she also loves it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2030150"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2030150#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2027849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1370343">Nanalvzpink</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-07">01/07/24 22:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is one that I would use to deodorize a bathroom or a living area. Its a scent that Ive actually smelled in a bathroom.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2024007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2024007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2021210" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1422167">ShayaK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-28">12/28/23 04:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It reminds me a little of Este Lauder Bronze Goddess. Picture yourself basking in the sun, surrounded by the subtle notes of sun tan oil that enhance the tropical experience. This fragrance captures the exotic allure of a sun-warmed beach with the floral sweetness of tiare flower and ylang. It's very nice to wear during the summertime.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="2012924"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=2012924#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2011276" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; "Smells like a Florida beach," he said.<br />
<br />
Nicely done!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1996934"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1996934#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1995454" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1995454" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shimmer412"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889185"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1889185.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shimmer412" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Yum-Boujee-Marshmallow-81-99254.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.99254.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Yum Boujee Marshmallow | 81"title="Yum Boujee Marshmallow | 81"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1995454ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1995454" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889185">Shimmer412</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-07">12/07/23 18:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Absolute perfection capturing the essence of a tropical beach walk! Its 1 of my all time favorites! Think fresh ocean breeze, salt water, sand, the feel of the sun on your skin, sweet and creamy coconut, solar florals, and that sweet almost sun tan lotion like scent only much better and chic! Its fresh, sweet, and a realistic and nostalgic beach smelling fragrance 1 of the very best that I have ever come across! I wear this regularly in the summer rotating between a few other fragrances including Tom Ford Soleil Blanc, Nest Sunkissed Hibiscus, Este Lauder Bronze Goddess, and a few others! I have the 3.4oz bottle as well as the travel spray so that I can always carry it with me! I get great performance with this! The longevity is fantastic I can still smell it on me the next morning! The silage is great too! The first time I wore this around my boyfriend he stopped a few feet away from me and said you just smell really really great!! If youre a fan of beachy/coconut/sun tan lotion like fragrances then I highly suggest that you give this one a try! Ill definitely always be keeping this in my collection and rotation because I just cant get enough of this divine beach scent!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1995454"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1995454#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994582" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Does smell good though, to be tried again 4/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1994582"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1994582#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1590854">eaudeaesthetic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-06">12/06/23 19:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Simple tropical vibes perfume,yellow flower plus coconut.it's not oceanic/aquatic.lovely</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1994515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1994515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1991271" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1991271" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hellbooru"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1421525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1421525.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hellbooru" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1991271ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1991271" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1421525">Hellbooru</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-03">12/03/23 06:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells much more like sunscreen than a walk on the beach. I have some Hawaiian Tropics sunscreen I like to layer this scent with, I think that brings out the best of the fragrance and magnifies the coconut note. But I am a sucker for the sunscreen scent. <br />
On it's own, the initial scent is a very strong floral with a hint of salt. It dries down to a powdery, musky coconut. I think if you don't go in expecting a "beachy" fragrance, and are looking more for slightly tropical, powdery floral this could be up your alley.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1991271"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1991271#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1991074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1987197" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oxeslevy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708879"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="oxeslevy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1987197ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1987197" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1708879">oxeslevy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-28">11/28/23 06:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First impressions... It smells plasticity and cheap. I'm not getting the salty sea air aspect at all. Just sweet floral sun lotion. Smells like a perfume that could be targeted at children. Very "my little pony". Reminds me of Tinkerbell make-up from the 1980s and cupcake dolls.<br />
I'm finding the ylang-ylang and is just too much and it has given me a headache. <br />
Perhaps I might like it more on a different day but today it's a no thank you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1987197"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1987197#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1986153" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; After the dry down you get a sweet coconut and and lightly spicy scent. Kinda like old sunscreen. Its pleasant, not something I feel like Id wear so much as something Id just smell. Because of its sunscreen smell i wouldnt want smell like I just got back from the pool. Unless I did, and then I would wear this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1986153"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1986153#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1985048" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/442334">km9699</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-22">11/22/23 16:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An ephemeral lemon splash opening that dries down to a lovely ylang-ylang soliflore with a hint of coconut-scented sunscreen. This EDT lingers for a while more than I expected, and is overall a pleasant, sunny treat.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1982931"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1982931#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979085" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Lacks freshness, very lab-created composition.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1979085"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1979085#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1977309" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1977281" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dantar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1474653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1474653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dantar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1977281ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1977281" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1474653">dantar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-15">11/15/23 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Realistic sunscreen with florals. I know everyone calls ANYTHING smelling slightly like coconut sunscreen but this one truly feels like lathering on sunscreen while wearing a floral perfume. Its a little salty, so it really gives the impression of the beach without feeling aquatic. Initially you can definitely tell theres a difference between this and Alien Goddess, but once it dries down they smell the same. So no need to get both if you have one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1977281"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1977281#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1974756" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I prefer the powdery aspect of BW, though. Wore this yesterday layered with Nuxe body oil and found it to be very uplifting in cold weather! Still, this is a summer scent through and through. It's a like for me, not a love. Longevity is poor - need to reapply often.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1974756"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1974756#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1973229" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1844603">HazardousEncyclopedia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-08">11/08/23 19:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose, this is very similar to the sunscreen, salt, and coconut smell of the much cheaper Demeter Sea Air.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1972132"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1972132#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1969620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1969620" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maryam.marcy.may.marlene"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427808"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1427808.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maryam.marcy.may.marlene" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/Devotion-84951.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84951.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Devotion"title="Devotion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1969620ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1969620" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427808">Maryam.marcy.may.marlene</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-05">11/05/23 20:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i live in Singapore and we don't really have nice beaches but i love how this scent reminds me of those days staying indoors with just bath&amp;bodyworks 3-wick candles in hopes to feel more outdoorsy at home. it's a comforting scent. it also reminds me of Target home decor section for some reason. this scent is more suited for a room diffuser in my humble opinion. i dont mind wearing this if you go to a private beach like Merimbula or Montauk but not very suitable for asian beaches. idk why. this feels very western-y private and luxurious. the top and middle notes stays impressively quite a while and when it gets to the base notes only then i get that Bali vibe. it's a safe blind buy. overall i love this scent!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
