padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1811972">barbieswanlake</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-31">10/31/23 05:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I LOVE Beach Walk I really do. I bought this in a 10ml and I already know Im gonna have to buy the 30. The pepper comes through in such a fun way for me, Ive smelled some fragrances where its really obvious but it just complements it so well here. It really does smell like a beach day to me (an idealised beach day of course), the coconut milk really helps that though I would have never been able to name it without reading the notes here. I live in a city with excellent beaches and near constant grey weather and I feel like Beach Walk sums up the city nearly perfectly. Very creamy, I see why others are getting sunscreen vibes for sure</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1964970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1964970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1964035" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/161734">marienette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-25">10/25/23 05:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow... So I love coconutty summer scents like Harajuku Lovers G (the original one) and Alien Goddess, so I was at least expecting to like this one. But sorry, Beach Walk makes me feel so nauseated. The floral (ylang ylang I guess) is overpowering and suffocating and the frag, overall, somehow smells like burnt chemicals and old ladies.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; DO NOT FALL FOR THIS CRAP</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1959493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1959493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1957604" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1957604" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LEM922"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275562"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275562.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LEM922" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1957604ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1957604" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275562">LEM922</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-21">10/21/23 11:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pretty straightforward ylang ylang scent. Theres coconut, but its definitely muted. Solar, yellow florals dominate the composition. Reminds me of Gucci Bloom PDF in the opening, just not as floral or photorealistic. This dries down pretty quickly, leaving a hint of heliotrope and musk behind. The drydown is more pleasant than the opening, but it becomes extremely faint in the process. It does have a beachy, sunscreen type of vibe, but this definitely isnt a soleil blanc dupe to me whatsoever. Lasting power weak. It smells nice, but I wouldnt go out of my way to buy this. The home fragrance line of this is probably really nice, like the candles and reed diffusers and such. Pleasant, sunny, forgettable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1957604"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1957604#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1953785" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1953785" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kat315"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1426323"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kat315" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Nectarine-Blossom-Honey-3782.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3782.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nectarine Blossom & Honey"title="Nectarine Blossom & Honey"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1953785ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1953785" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1426323">Kat315</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-16">10/16/23 21:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I originally saw this I thought I would love it, it is safe to say I am extremely disappointed. When it comes to natural smells I like the beach and ocean breeze is by far my favorite smell on Earth. I adore the smell of coconuts and it is usually a safe note for me, it is hard to remember any perfume with coconut that I have picked up and disliked. I just got a sample of this from sephora and tried it out in store and honestly it reminds me more of a childs toy box than the beach. It smells like a crayon nothing else, I actually prefer hypnotic poison when it comes to toy box scents. I have a tester of coco lada by adopt that I was gifted by a friend after her recent trip to Paris and I actually find that that reminds me of the beach more than this overrated bottle. This coming from a replica lover who currently has two full bottles of replica perfumes at home and someone who wishes they hadnt missed the chance to buy some of their older scents I loved.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1953785"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1953785#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1951144" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Would smell nice on my wife.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1933154"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1933154#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1932883" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1932883" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="QueenieIrenie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1274913"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1274913.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="QueenieIrenie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Orchestre-Parfum/Piano-Santal-57336.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57336.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Piano Santal "title="Piano Santal "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1932883ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1932883" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1274913">QueenieIrenie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 12:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@zefragrancec Beach Walk may not be super original by today's standards, but I don't think it was that way when it came out in 2012. Seems a bit unfair though to criticize Beach Walk for smelling like Alien Goddess (2021) or Narciso Ambree (2020) when it predates them both by about a decade.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1932883"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1932883#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1932818" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1932818" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zefragrancec"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703512"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1703512.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zefragrancec" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/You-Or-Someone-Like-You-43531.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43531.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You Or Someone Like You"title="You Or Someone Like You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1932818ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1932818" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703512">zefragrancec</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 11:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>overhyped and underwhelming. I was expecting a mind blowing fragrance but it literally just smells like mugler alien goddess and narciso ambree lmfao</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1932818"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1932818#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1931669" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1931669" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1931669ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1931669" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-19">09/19/23 04:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There's something about Maison Martin Margiela's "Beach Walk" that reminds me of the wet and salt water drenched skin of a surfer at Venice Beach or Bondi. <br />
<br />
The beginning has a zesty bite from the lemon and bergamot. It is a very musky fragrance from here on out (from the musk, of course) as well and the ylang ylang gives this fragrance a hint of tropical yellow floracy and banana-like nuances. The pink pepper mixes with the musk and the benzoin and gives me that "salty" sea air quality. Lastly, I get a hint of a vague vanillic smell in the drydown from the benzoin and heliotrope combined.<br />
<br />
I find this a very summery fragrance that leans slightly feminine and that it would be good to just throw on for those times you just want to be on the go, like for casual affairs for instance.<br />
<br />
The projection from Beach Walk is moderate and so is its longevity. It lasted 5 and a half hours on me in total. You get a fair amount of ml for your money and this isn't bad for a mass-produced designer fragrance. In saying that though, I'd still only give this a 6/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1931669"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1931669#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1931119" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1931119" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="abc1111"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1034259"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1034259.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="abc1111" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Yum-Boujee-Marshmallow-81-99254.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.99254.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Yum Boujee Marshmallow | 81"title="Yum Boujee Marshmallow | 81"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1931119ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1931119" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1034259">abc1111</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-18">09/18/23 12:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Between okay and like. I get citrus, flowers, coconut, a little salt, AND plastic. Hard to explain but its like the smell of plastic bags or cheap toys. From three different sources (sample vial, travel-sized spray, and full bottle), that plastic scent is present.<br />
<br />
Compared to Tom Fords, this is closer to Eau de Soleil Blanc EDT than Soleil Blanc EDP.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1931119"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1931119#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1930111" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1930111" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Einfinken"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1840930"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Einfinken" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/Santal-Blanc-55226.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55226.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Blanc"title="Santal Blanc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1930111ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1930111" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1840930">Einfinken</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-17">09/17/23 06:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There are so many perfumes that do coconut and ylang-ylang better. Nothing in this scent stands out to me as special or particularly memorable.  It's not a bad scent, but I just think it is a very average (and thus overpriced) take on the the beachy sunscreen type of fragrance. Used it for two summers and am glad to be done with the bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1930111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1930111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1929105" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1929105" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whateverwhocares"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1757007.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whateverwhocares" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1929105ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1929105" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007">Whateverwhocares</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-16">09/16/23 00:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lemon, orange, coconut, ylang-ylang, pepper and an aquatic musky mist. Clean and fresh, but in a mildly chemical way. Smells like a cloroxd pool near a beach. That said, the lemon note is of decent quality and not a cleaning product. <br />
<br />
Unisex, but definitely much better on a woman than a man. Not bad, just meh;  but can be considered a .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1929105"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1929105#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1922041" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1922041" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BerryRose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1216775"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1216775.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BerryRose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1922041ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1922041" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1216775">BerryRose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-07">09/07/23 10:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beach Walk is the lone survivor of the original Maison Margiela Replica's launch in 2012. I'm not sure when Funfair Evening was discontinued but Flower Market was available until sometime last year. The original Replica fragrances that were discontinued seem to have been replaced by the similarly themed Springtime in the Park and On a Date. Beach Walk appears to have been successful enough that they haven't released something similar enough to cannibalize it's own sales. <br />
<br />
How does Beach Walk compare to other summer, beach-themed fragrances? For me Beach Walk is definitely not as good as the "best bang for buck" in the category Bronze Goddess or the "best splurge" Coccobello. However, it's more similar in style to these two fragrances than it is to Bobbi Brown's Beach (which is much more fresh and oceanic) or Jil Sander's Sun (which much more powdery and spicy). There is most definitely a coconut note to Beach Walk which makes it lean gourmand but it's nowhere near as  distinctive as The Body Shop's Coconut. <br />
<br />
Overall it's very middle of the road and out of all my beach-themed fragrances it's the one I like the least. It's not bad, and the bottle is nice, but it's just not doing anything better than any of the others, especially for the price point (and it's also an EDT). Even though I received a compliment on it from a stranger the first time I wore it ("You smell so good!") I don't feel the need to keep it in my collection. I only bring out my perfumes one season at a time and keep the rest in a cupboard, but even then I have limited vanity space. I don't seem myself reaching for this when I have so many other beach-inspired fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1922041"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1922041#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1920217" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1920217" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="carrico1986"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153909"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153909.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="carrico1986" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1920217ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1920217" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153909">carrico1986</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-05">09/05/23 08:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very realistic tropical beach scent! It lives up to its name. Salty, ocean breeze,and the scent of coconuts wafting in the air. Very beautiful. Another scent immediately came to mind though once I sprayed it; Tom Ford's Soleil blanc; minus the pistachio note. They are almost identical, with Beachwalk smelling a little more realistic of the ocean. If you have one you don't need the other.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1920217"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1920217#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1917671" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Those little scented paper things you hang in your car - thats it pretty much, just a little softer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1917671"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1917671#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1917138" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1917138" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SarahET"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1746514"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1746514.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SarahET" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1917138ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1917138" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); It's not the typical coconut sunscreen summer offering. For someone wanting a fragrance for a tropical vacation, you might look elsewhere.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1917138"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1917138#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1916162" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1916162" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yayimhere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777066"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1777066.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yayimhere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1916162ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1916162" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); I like it, but I feel like it just doesn't last, like I'd wear it out, but if it gets too windy the sillage just goes down. Not really something I want from a perfume with that price. I also do think that there are stronger scents out there that last longer and are cheaper.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1916162"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1916162#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1915822" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1915822" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MazaZilite"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1754388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1754388.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MazaZilite" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Who-is-Elijah/Rebel-Rose-91075.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91075.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rebel Rose "title="Rebel Rose "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1915822ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1915822" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1754388">MazaZilite</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-30">08/30/23 20:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance should have been named Springtime In A Park. It is definitely not a walk on the beach - there is nothing aquatic, salty, or even coconutty about it! The initial scent is a sweet, powdery floral. On my skin it dries down to a musky, milky skin-scent (okay, possibly reminiscent of sunscreen).<br />
<br />
Quite a pleasant Replica offering, but nothing to rave about, and undoubtedly there are similar fragrances at a cheaper price point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1915822"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1915822#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1913473" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; If I wanted this vibe, I could just put some coconut tanning oil on... Also, I get a hint of the hairspray smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1913473"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1913473#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1912088" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1912088" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ModernPrincessss"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1820280"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ModernPrincessss" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Baccarat-Rouge-540-33519.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33519.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baccarat Rouge 540"title="Baccarat Rouge 540"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1912088ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1912088" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1820280">ModernPrincessss</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-26">08/26/23 11:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really liked this upon initial spray because the initial spray reminds me of what dolce garden smells like after drying down and I really love dolce gardens' sweet fluffy lactonic dry down on my skin. I was really just hoping for this to be great to layer with garden to make gardens dry down stronger and more long lasting but I didn't realize until I waited for beach wall's dry down that it ends up having more of a sunscreen kind of vibe once settled. Beach walk is still a great sweet, lightly floral without being powdery kind of scent and the though sunscreen vibe in the dry down wasn't my jam but I would still recommend for anyone that wants a not so overly sweet, coconut, sunny fragrance for vacation vibes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1666649">LynneFaubert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-17">08/17/23 09:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my third time wearing a Beach Walk sample and its a charm. I dont remember how the first two performed, I had bought 20 decants at the same time, so BW was lost in the multitude. Not this time. The first hour or so, it was aquatic and floral, nice enough. Then an almost sunscreen like coconut came bursting through, with a touch of fruit early on, followed by a milky musk. This is a cool summer perfume that delivers on its name. (Reading previous reviewers, Im tended to add on my skin at least). Its so much about the interraction between your body and the scent, I still dont get Baccarat Rouge and it sure doesnt get me Recommend if you love tropical coconut.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1904473"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1904473#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899476" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It does remind oneself of Soleil Blanc but a touch of more powderyness and femininity. A layed back sunscreen scented female fragrance. Something inbetween Soleil Blanc and Idole Aura to me. A day  fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1899476"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1899476#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1892435" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1892435" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="washudtoj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1327091"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1327091.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="washudtoj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Body-Shop/Full-Ylang-Ylang-82679.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.82679.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Full Ylang Ylang"title="Full Ylang Ylang"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1892435ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1892435" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1327091">washudtoj</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-02">08/02/23 06:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one is totally meh for me. It smells like Nivea sunscreen but a LOT more expensive, with no sunscreening power. It's coconuty and musky, with ylang-ylang, but that's all. I wouldn't ever spend $$$$$$$$$$$$$ for this thing.<br />
<br />
It's also potent and pungent. I do find it offensive, but if it's on someone else, I wouldn't mind because then I won't have to smell it all the time. I only put two sprays on me, one on each wrist, and already I find it strong. I think it's the ylang-ylang.<br />
<br />
It's feminine more than unisex, and also extremely creamy. I don't find it worth the price at all. Glad I didn't blind buy this but bought a 1ml sample instead.<br />
<br />
Some people like it. It's summery and beachy, but I'll stick with Issey Miyake if I want a beachy scent. Their summer editions are much better and worth the price than this. If the ylang-ylang is changed to frangipani, it would be better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1892435"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1892435#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1889758" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1889758" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gemsense"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1157351"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1157351.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gemsense" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nest/Madagascar-Vanilla-Perfume-Oil-66886.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66886.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madagascar Vanilla Perfume Oil"title="Madagascar Vanilla Perfume Oil"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1889758ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1889758" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1157351">Gemsense</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-29">07/29/23 07:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells its best between 60 degrees Fahrenheit and 70 degrees.  It kinda gross smelling in hot weather cuz it smells watery. But in cooler warm weather its gorgeous and thats when I absolutely love it! Anything warmer and its spoiled.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1889758"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1889758#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880841" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1880841" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="oddsoy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1765244.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="oddsoy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Room-1015/Cherry-Punk-61264.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61264.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cherry Punk"title="Cherry Punk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1880841ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1880841" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1765244">oddsoy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-17">07/17/23 13:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>perfect lightweight summer fragrance.. the initial yellow floral notes are so beautiful, and the deep layers of coconut and tropical fruits give it almost a sunscreen smell. the powdery vanilla nuance is also very beautiful. doesn't last super long, but the projection is there.<br />
<br />
7/10 (+6 for being a good perfume, +1 for refreshing floral-tropical scent)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1880841"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1880841#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880569" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1880569" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Allthingssparkle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1523254"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1523254.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Allthingssparkle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1880569ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1880569" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1523254">Allthingssparkle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-17">07/17/23 06:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I lived in Florida on the Gulf Coast for 17 years, so when I smell this, I think of a light men's cologne sprayed inside a seashell!  Margiela definitely captured a tropical beach in this fragrance!  No doubt about it -- this is a walk on the beach in a bottle.  They did an incredible job capturing that.<br />
<br />
However, it leans masculine to me.  When I smell this, I think "cologne."  Like a vintage cologne.  The cologne element isn't strong, like you get when you spray most men's colognes....no, it's not going to choke you out or anything...but it smells "like a cologne" rather than "like a perfume."  There's not enough in this to make it feminine to me.<br />
<br />
To me....this is "a moment in a place."  And that's what makes this PERFECT as an air freshener or wax melt for a beachy vibe!  If I had to make a correlation, it's kind of like that wonderful aroma of onion, green pepper and celery that's boiling in the kitchen to make gravy for the winter holidays..... it's AMAZING, but I wouldn't want to spray it on me and wear it as a fragrance.<br />
<br />
I actually wore Beach Walk on one hand for a day, and I can testify that it LASTS!  It's not loud, but it's definitely persistent.  I just didn't enjoy "wearing" it as a fragrance and looked forward to washing it off.  It just felt odd to smell that way.  That said, the cologne vibe in this makes it more appropriate for my husband, so I think I'll pass it along to him.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1880569"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1880569#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880264" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1880264"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1880264#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="15261" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>

</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1073722" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FoundALandmine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1198294"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1198294.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FoundALandmine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-des-Sens-Eau-de-Toilette-35678.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35678.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau des Sens Eau de Toilette"title="Eau des Sens Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1073722ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1073722" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1198294">FoundALandmine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-27">06/27/19 09:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a little puzzled by the reviews that say this doesn't smell beachy. To me, this is the *precise* scent of a day at the beach. Sunscreen, warm sand, salty ocean <br />
air. I struggle to find perfumes that I enjoy, that don't give me a headache, or make me sneezy. So I tend to gravitate towards scents that aren't overly complex, and give the impression that I just naturally smell that awesome, haha. This is one of those scents! So if you're like me and like to wear fragrances that give off more of an aura and less of a perfumey punch, you'll probably like this. You'll just smell like a walking ball of nostalgic summer!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1073722"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1073722#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent877517" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/218458">blackmartini</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-11-05">11/05/17 10:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wish this had been created earlier. When I was younger, I was desperate to find a fragrance that smelled just like warm sand, sunkissed skin, salty air and happiness. I've finally found it.<br />
<br />
It's beautiful, so soothing, so peaceful, so bright. Like an endless blue sky with no clouds in sight. Kids are laughing and playing on the beach, I'm enjoying the weather on a freshly washed cotton towel, eating fruit and drinking lemonade. This is the good life.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="877517"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=877517#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1593712" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1593712" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dramaloladiva"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1309211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dramaloladiva" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Gris-Montaigne-17842.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17842.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Montaigne"title="Gris Montaigne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1593712ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1593712" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309211">Dramaloladiva</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-29">06/29/22 12:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I remember smelling Beach Walk for the first time a decade ago and thinking: Wow!! I have never smelled anything like this before! Not even the one called Beach by Bobbi Brown.<br />
10 years have passed since this came out and scores of perfumes have now inundated the market that smell similar to Beach Walk<br />
To me, Beach Walk will always be the one that started the coconut/sunscreen/salt-y skin/summer on the beach scent. It is so beautiful and though it is no longer unique or original, it smells like lazy summer days spent lying on the sand reading and sunbathing. I love it, always have, always will<br />
<br />
Perfection for Summertime!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1593712"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1593712#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent707910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc707910" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="catswearingperfume"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16508"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16508.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="catswearingperfume" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma707910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd707910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16508">catswearingperfume</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-22">05/22/16 07:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beach scents can be a difficult thing to capture, but Martin Margiela's Beach Walk captures it beautifully. This fragrance smells like a cross between fresh laundry and salty sea air in the very best way. The mistake many beach fragrances make IMO is that they lean too heavily on the coconut, making the finished product smell more like a tanning product. This fragrance leans on a salty, aquatic profile woven throughout a sweet (but not fruity) floral musk to convey its beach theme, and the result is authentically beachy, clean, and feminine. The lasting power is amazing on me as well, I can spray this in the morning and still smell it on my skin at the end of the day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="707910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=707910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1018732" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It smells just like suntan lotion and that's exactly what I wanted.  Coconutty, floral, and musky.  Love!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1018732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1018732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="15261" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
