    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent577929" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc577929" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="raw umber"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/415586"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.415586.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="raw umber" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma577929ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd577929" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/415586">raw umber</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-18">03/18/15 14:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I own both Beach Walk and Bobbi Brown Beach, and I can assure you they are Nothing alike at all! Bobbi Brown Beach is a scarily accurate representation of the actual north Atlantic coast with the sharpness of the bright sunlight, frigid salty surf and potency of sunscreen. It's not pretty in a classic sense, but it's very interesting and fun to wear..very transportive.<br />
<br />
Replica Beach Walk is much more an actual (clean musk) perfume than a beach facsimile. Soft non-sour citrus and aquatic notes like those present in Womanity make up the opening with some watered down ylang. The drydown is quite powdery due to heliotrope with some bitter mineral saltiness and very soft coconut with pillowy musk. It wears close to the skin and recalls very much the perfume Memoire Liquid Vacances, another beachy floral/citrus musk. <br />
<br />
I strongly prefer Bobbi Brown Beach because it delivers what it promises (an actual beach) rather than smelling like a "perfume based on the beach theme." <br />
<br />
Bobbi Brown Beach also strongly recalls the ocean, while managing to entirely omit the somewhat objectionable Womanity aquatic note present in Beach Walk. Also, Beach Walk shows more abstract citrus on my skin than I usually like in these types of scents.<br />
<br />
That said, both are enjoyable and worth a test.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="577929"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=577929#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1070874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1070874" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Drbeastmaster"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092596"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1092596.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Drbeastmaster" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/Light-Blue-Swimming-in-Lipari-29960.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29960.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Light Blue Swimming in Lipari"title="Light Blue Swimming in Lipari"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1070874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1070874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092596">Drbeastmaster</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-17">06/17/19 14:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I gotta disagree with alot of other reviewers on here. Im a man but ordered a sample to try it and i really wanted to like this but i just dont. People talked about this having a nice coconut in the opening but im not getting that , i get lots of yellow floras / ylang ylang thats very feminine. Me and my wife tried this and both of are first reactions were this reminds us nothing of the beach( we live by the beach). Its borderline headache inducing to me and was tempted to scrub it off. the dry reveals some coconut but still has the strong floral to me. ITs defiantly not a safe blind buy and leans heavy feminine . It to bad because i love lipstick and by the fire by MM..... owell</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1070874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1070874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1213787" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1213787" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GenevaX"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196983"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1196983.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GenevaX" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1213787ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1213787" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196983">GenevaX</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-20">08/20/20 02:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This succeeds in smelling like someone's abstract fantasy of a tasteful, upscale resort vacation.  It's coconutty, powdery, vaguely floral, and musky, and smells like an almost-luxury hotel - three stars pretending to be four - circa 2007.  It is a weirdly nostalgic scent, and that seems to be what MMM aims for in this collection. It's nostalgic in a slightly kitsch way, which isn't necessarily bad, but probably not what they were aiming for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1213787"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1213787#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1350192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1350192" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Oli Omphalos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1335884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1335884.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Oli Omphalos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1350192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1350192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1335884">Oli Omphalos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-27">05/27/21 12:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like plastic. Not literally, I guess artificial is a better word for it, but still, when I smelled this, the only images evoked were plastic flowers, plastic coconut shreds, and plastic pails that you put sand in. It's more reminiscent of a water theme park than a beach.<br />
<br />
4 out of 10 for me. The price point of this brand is pretty high, but you wouldn't guess it if you smelled this blindfolded.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1350192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1350192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1003433" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1003433" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Joys of life"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169858"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1169858.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Joys of life" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Jersey-Eau-de-Parfum-41776.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41776.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jersey Eau de Parfum"title="Jersey Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1003433ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1003433" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169858">Joys of life</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-23">11/23/18 07:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im so depressed. <br />
I love beach scents, but maybe Im expecting something different. I was thinking something like Virgin Island Water by Creed or Tokyo Milks Marine Sel. I do NOT want to smell like synthetic sunscreen spilled on hot boardwalk, and thats all I smell here. Smells metallic and harsh on my skin.. and honestly very cheap. I will say I also didnt like Bobbi Brown Beach either (although I think its more subtle and well done than this) so if you do you may like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="15261"comment_id="1003433"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html?ccid=1003433#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="15261" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

            <em>basgam</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.289187.jpg"

                <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Brands</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Dior.html" class="en2inter">Dior</a>
        </span>
    </div>

        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">4.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>
    </div>

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">5.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Guerlain.html" class="en2inter">Guerlain</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">53.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Azzaro.html" class="en2inter">Azzaro</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">54.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Narciso-Rodriguez.html" class="en2inter">Narciso Rodriguez</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">55.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Frederic-Malle.html" class="en2inter">Frederic Malle</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">56.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Montblanc.html" class="en2inter">Montblanc</a>
        </span>
    </div>

    <script>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
